body: Both have royalty agreements for other companies to build plants and pay royalties
CMC on Jan 2021 10 cents SP on low volume (2-7M per day)
Mar 2021 (three months later) $1.62 SP on 50M volume (just under 10% of all shares)
Has since pulled back as tech is not commercially verified yet (PQE‚Äôs tech has been 3rd party FEED verified)
PQE trading at 13 cents USD on 2-7M volume per day has pulled back from June high mostly due to issues with TSX halt (issued shares below TSX min price without prior approval)
IMO we can easily the CMC type of run (from $0.10 to $1.62) with PQE once TSX starts trading again and more people understand what is going on here

$PQEFF If we want to talk about ridiculous but possible number - Suncor in 2020 recorded $10.5B (average oil price was $40 per barrel) revenue from Oil Sands but due to price of operation and low oil prices last year they actually had a net loss from Oil Sands of $5B
created_at: now imagine if they used PQE's technology and reduced their cost down to $22 per barrel and sold the sand for $10 per barrel
column3: ask yourself how much this tech would be worth to Suncor? Now if PQE signs a license agreement with Suncor and after several years their total oil sands production was through PQE license agreement with a 5% royalty (I believe it would be on Net not Gross revenue but still with $80 oil the $10.5B would be $21B with a net revenue of probably $10B time 5% royalty is ..... $500 Million PER YEAR!!! that is one of the top 5 oil sands producers in Canada only. Expand this around the world and within 5 years this could be easily a $10B company ($16.66 SP) on royalties alone
